Description: Rim and body sherd with handle scar of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim (top lost); interior: on rim, many dilute lines between black bands; on body, broad black band outside dilute line, black band and series of dilute lines; exterior: rim and handle zone reserved with band between; wall glazed with reserved band low down.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same cup as 1965,0930.628 and 629. Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile finds parallels with his Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.675) (Phase 3)
